page.title: 06FARMING
page.content: THE FARMLAND IN THIS BLOCK IS ALL PERFECTLY FLAT. IT WAS RECLAIMED FROM SALTMARSH IN THREE PHASES. THE FIRST WAS IN THE 163OS AND THE OTHER TWO IN THE 19THC.THE SEA BANK CONSISTS OF MAINTAINED SAND DUNES. OUTSIDE THE BANK IS SALTMARSH WHICH IS ACCRETING AND BEYOND THAT MUDFLATS BEING COLONISED BY SAMPHIRE WHICH IS PICKED AND EATEN PICKLED BY LOCAL PEOPLE BUT ALONG WITH MOST OTHER TRADITIONAL PRACTICES THIS IS DYING OUT. OUTSIDE THIS ARE VAST AREAS OF SAND FORMED INTO RIDGES BY THE SEA. BECAUSE THE BEACH IS GENTLY SLOPING THE EXACT POINT OF HIGH TIDE VARIES A LOT.
